quotes.author: African Wisdom

quotes.quote: Identity would seem to be the garment with which one covers the nakedness of the self, in which case, it is best that the garment be loose, a little like the robes of the desert, through which one's nakedness can always be felt, and sometimes, discerned.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: God made us in his own image, and he had some purpose when he thus created us; then why should we seek to destroy our identity?
quotes.author: Marcus Garvey

quotes.quote: We ain't what we wanna be, and we ain't what we gonna be. But thank God, we ain't what we was.
quotes.author: African-American Wisdom

quotes.quote: And she had nothing to fall back on; not maleness, not whiteness, not ladyhood, not anything. And out of profound desolation of her reality, she may very well have invented herself.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.quote: We need to update the vision of who we really are. We need to recognize that wherever we have come from and whatever we have brought from different regions, even in awkward circumstances—all of it—is really our heritage.
quotes.author: Earl Lovelace

quotes.quote: Once you know who you are, you don't have to worry anymore. She knows who she is because she knows who she isn't.
quotes.author: Nikki Giovanni

quotes.quote: Whatever is a source of shame—if you are not responsible for it, such as the color of your skin or your sexuality—you should just wear it as a badge.
quotes.author: Jamaica Kincaid

quotes.quote: I wanted freedom to invent and reinvent myself. You have to tell the world,'I define myself, I will not be defined.'
quotes.author: Bill T. Jones

quotes.quote: We can't rely on anyone but ourselves to define our existence, to shape the image of ourselves.
quotes.author: Spike Lee

quotes.quote: Labels are very important to me. They're a way of finding community and a way of community finding you.For me, identity is a kind of mailbox.
quotes.author: Nalo Hopkinson

quotes.quote: Many of us are confused about what to call ourselves...As important as they are...no words can encompass your whole identity. Don't allow anyone to box you into a category that doesn't satisfy you and, just as importantly, do not allow anyone to remove a part of your identity as a price for their acceptance of you.
quotes.author: Keith Boykin

quotes.quote: Everyone should be proud of being what he is, otherwise, something has gone seriously wrong.
quotes.author: Northrop Frye

quotes.quote: We are to ourselves just what we think we are.
quotes.author: Phineas Quimby

quotes.quote: If you wish to be successful you must identify with success. The law of identity is a definite thing. That with which you mentally identify yourself sets up an image of thought in your consciousness which tends to attract the situations with which you are mentally identified.
quotes.author: Ernest Holmes

quotes.quote: We are dominated by everything with which our self becomes identified. We can dominate and control everything from which we disidentify ourselves.
quotes.author: Roberto Assagioli

quotes.quote: Man is made in such a way that he continually has to define himself and continually escape his own definitions.
quotes.author: Witold Gombrowicz

quotes.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
quotes.author: Witold Gombrowicz

quotes.quote: If you do not know your own identity, who is going to identify you?...If you want to identify me, ask me not where I live, or what I like to eat, or how I comb my hair, but ask me what I am living for, in detail, and ask me what I think is keeping me from living fully for the thing I want to live for.
quotes.author: Thomas Merton

quotes.quote: We must not allow other people's limited perceptions to define us.
quotes.author: Virginia Satir

quotes.quote: In the animal kingdom, the rule is, eat or be eaten; in the human kingdom, define or be defined.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz

quotes.quote: Identity is a simple kind of negotiation individuals make with each individuals to give each other the illusion of separate independence.
quotes.author: Chandler Brossard

quotes.quote: We turn to the company of those who share our most intimate and forbidden identity, and there we begin to find ourselves as persons.
quotes.author: Theodore Roszak

quotes.quote: Know yourself, and your neighbor will not mistake you.
quotes.author: Scottish Saying

quotes.quote: But an accurate definition of the self is impossible. You are more than you realize, more than you can define. And the more time you spend trying to nail down the definition, the less time you spend living right now. Your past is not your identity...You living now is our identity.
quotes.author: George Lawrence

quotes.quote: Since my identity is my land / My actions are the identity of it / Therefore, I move, at every step / With care and responsibility
quotes.author: Ehsan Sehgal

quotes.quote: A cool identity isn't a need / let those you bully be freed / Your identity should be your own / A better person you will be known.
quotes.author: Jon Evans

quotes.quote:
Who am I if I ain't loving you? / Baby / Who am I if you're not loving me? / Tell me /
'Cause you and me, that's my identity.
quotes.author: Philip Meckseper

quotes.quote: Mistaken identity / When it really really wasn't me / You're trying to convict me / But you know me not guilty.
quotes.author: Snow

quotes.quote: Don't care where you come from / As long as you're a black man, you're an African / No mind your nationality / You have got the identity of an African.
quotes.author: Peter Tosh

quotes.quote: You can imprison a man, but not an idea. You can exile a man, but not an idea. You can kill a man, but not an idea.
quotes.author: Benazir Bhutto

quotes.quote: Political ideology can corrupt the mind, and science.
quotes.author: E. O. Wilson

quotes.quote: Ideologies separate us. Dreams and anguish bring us together.
quotes.author: Eugene Ionesco

quotes.quote: Ideologies are mental prisons that produce blindness.
quotes.author: Fernando Araya

quotes.quote: Ideologies exist only where there is no absolute knowledge. If you know something, you do not have to believe or disbelieve it.
quotes.author: Idries Shah

quotes.quote: All ideologies are idiotic, whether religious or political, for it is conceptual thinking, the conceptual word, which has so unfortunately divided man.
quotes.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quotes.quote: Violent ideologies follow their own logic, the logic that sustains the system - a convoluted logic that unravels when it, itself, is labeled.
quotes.author: Melanie Joy

quotes.quote: An idea is something you have; an ideology is something that has you.
quotes.author: Morris Berman

quotes.quote: My feet are firmly planted in my political ideology. To me, it's being authentic in every area, and that includes politics.
quotes.author: Natasha Rothwell

quotes.quote: Ideology is strong exactly because it is no longer experienced as ideology… we feel free because we lack the very language to articulate our unfreedom.
quotes.author: Slavoj Žižek

quotes.quote: Individual cultures and ideologies have their appropriate uses but none of them erase or replace the universal experiences, like love and weeping and laughter, common to all human beings.
quotes.author: Aberjhani

quotes.quote: It is possible to lead astray an entire generation, to strike it blind, to drive it insane, to direct it towards a false goal. Napoleon proved this.
quotes.author: Alexander Herzen

quotes.quote: No matter where you stand politically - even if you're unsure of what your political ideology is - it is important to take part in the process of shaping our government.
quotes.author: Brad Henry

quotes.quote: I think of feminism as more of a political ideology.
quotes.author: Callie Khouri

quotes.quote: Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell.
quotes.author: Edward Abbey

quotes.quote: There is no religion in which everyday life is not considered a prison; there is no philosophy or ideology that does not think that we live in alienation.
quotes.author: Eugene Ionesco

quotes.quote: What we do with our lives largely depends on the philosophy of life we have subjected our lives to as a way of living life, and which controls, move and directs our lives!
quotes.author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

quotes.quote: It is perfectly acceptable in a free and liberal society to criticize, debate, mock, and reject any ideology.
quotes.author: Gad Saad

quotes.quote: Americans have not only a right but a responsibility to consider the values of those who seek to lead them - whether they arise from life experience, political ideology or religious belief.
quotes.author: Gary Bauer

quotes.quote: The Third World is not a reality but an ideology.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: An ideologue is one who places agenda above truth.
quotes.author: J.Adam Snyder

quotes.quote: You can compromise without violating your principles, but it is nearly impossible to compromise when you turn principles into ideology.
quotes.author: Jamie Dimon

quotes.quote: Ideologies have no heart of their own. They're the whores and angels of our striving selves.
quotes.author: John Le Carre

quotes.quote: My hope is that people begin to understand what the fiscal realities are - how economic virtue differs from political virtue - and develop a realization of their individual economic philosophy in comparison to their perceived political ideology.
quotes.author: Kurt Bills

quotes.quote: Ideology has shaped the very sofa on which I sit.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Religion makes people kill each other. Science supplies them with weapons.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: No mother would ever willingly sacrifice her sons for territorial gain, for economic advantage, for ideology.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: The ideology of capitalism makes us all into connoisseurs of liberty - of the indefinite expansion of possibility.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.quote: Life has become the ideology of its own absence.
quotes.author: Theodor W. Adorno

quotes.quote: The ultimate end of any ideology is totalitarianism.
quotes.author: Tom Robbins

quotes.quote: Hunger has no ideology. It does not respond to party or to rant. Hunger, in short, is not a red state/blue state problem.
quotes.author: Donna Brazile

quotes.quote: Men are restless, adventurous. Women are conservative - despite what current ideology says.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.quote: In presidential elections, I think people focus way too much on ideology.
quotes.author: Eric Garcetti

quotes.quote: Infected by political ideology, if you dare question climate models, your career is done.
quotes.author: Greg Gutfeld

quotes.quote: The main object of a revolution is the liberation of man... not the interpretation and application of some transcendental ideology.
quotes.author: Jean Genet

quotes.quote: Any type of political ideology is going to have a lot of different variants of it.
quotes.author: John Mackey

quotes.quote: Ideas are not dangerous unless they find seeding place in some earth more profound than the mind.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: You have your ideology and I have mine.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: Those who find it hypocritical of others to use, say, a smartphone, to speak ill of capitalism, needs to be reminded that capitalism is an ideology, not a technology.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: It is not with architecture that one can disseminate any political ideology.
quotes.author: Oscar Niemeyer

quotes.quote: The divisiveness that threatens the fabric of our nation - whether due to race, religion, political ideology, gender, sexual orientation, or other - must end.
quotes.author: Tulsi Gabbard

quotes.quote: If an idiot were to tell you the same story every day for a year, you would end by believing it.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.quote: To generalize is to be an idiot.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: Any idiot can face a crisis, it's day to day living that wears you out.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.quote: Never argue with an idiot. They will drag you down to their level and beat you with experience.
quotes.author: Sarah Cook

quotes.quote: Only idiots refuse to change their minds.
quotes.author: Brigitte Bardot

quotes.quote: You can't make anything idiot proof because idiots are so ingenious.
quotes.author: Ron Burns

quotes.quote: Don't keep reaching for the stars because you'll just look like an idiot stretching that way for no reason.
quotes.author: Jimmy Fallon

quotes.quote: In the first place God made idiots. This was for practice. Then he made school boards.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Don't be afraid of being scared. To be afraid is a sign of common sense. Only complete idiots are not afraid of anything.
quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quotes.quote: As usual, there is a great woman behind every idiot.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote: I'm just saying if you want to reach large audiences, then rely on professionals, meaning people who are in the industry and are trained for it, rather than just idiot savants.
quotes.author: Barry Diller

quotes.quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: Always remember, rumors are carried by haters, spread by fools, and accepted by idiots.
quotes.author: Ziad K. Abdelnour

quotes.quote: There's a fine line between fishing and just standing on the shore like an idiot.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.quote: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.
quotes.author: Salvador Dali

quotes.quote: I will not change. Because if you are successful and you change, you are an idiot.
quotes.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quotes.quote: I try and sit on the fence because as soon as you voice any kind of opinion, people begin to think you're an idiot.
quotes.author: Calvin Harris

quotes.quote: Suppose you were an idiot, and suppose you were a member of congress; but I repeat myself.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Nothing is more humiliating than to see idiots succeed in enterprises we have failed in.
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.quote: To generalize is to be an idiot. To particularize is the alone distinction of merit. General knowledge are those knowledge that idiots possess.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: Show me a good loser and I'll show you an idiot.
quotes.author: Leo Durocher

quotes.quote: When I become the village idiot, or at least, it starts to become a joke, you can't do that much longer.
quotes.author: Joan Van Ark

quotes.quote: Avoid and ignore the idiots who try to bring you down in life; they are not worth your time.
quotes.author: Ken Poirot

quotes.quote: Sometimes the world seems like a big hole. You spend all your life shouting down it and all you hear are echoes of some idiot yelling nonsense down a hole.
quotes.author: Adam Duritz

quotes.quote: It's better to dance like a fool, than to stand around like an idiot.
quotes.author: Oliver Gaspirtz

quotes.quote: Acting is the perfect idiot's profession.
quotes.author: Katharine Hepburn

quotes.quote: We know that the nature of genius is to provide idiots with ideas twenty years later.
quotes.author: Louis Aragon

quotes.quote: The main difference between men and women is that men are lunatics and women are idiots.
quotes.author: Rebecca West

quotes.quote: Go for a business that any idiot can run, because sooner or later, any idiot probably is going to run it.
quotes.author: Peter Lynch

quotes.quote: If I decide to be an idiot, then I'll be an idiot on my own accord.
quotes.author: Johann Sebastian Bach

quotes.quote: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: Once you're able to look like an idiot and be ok with it, it opens up your potential.
quotes.author: Nicole Sullivan

quotes.quote: In the first place, God made idiots. That was for practice. Then he made school boards.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: There is no one thoroughly despicable. We cannot descend much lower than an idiot; and an idiot has some advantages over a wise man.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: I say on the air all time, if you take what I say as gospel, you're an idiot.
quotes.author: Glenn Beck

quotes.quote: You treat an idiot like an idiot.
quotes.author: Bikram Choudhury

quotes.quote: Half the world is composed of idiots, the other half of people clever enough to take indecent advantage of them.
quotes.author: Walter Kerr

quotes.quote: You're an idealist, and I pity you as I would the village idiot.
quotes.author: Stanley Kubrick

quotes.quote: There's nothing more dangerous than a resourceful idiot.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: From the naturalistic point of view, all men are equal. There are only two exceptions to this rule of naturalistic equality: geniuses and idiots.
quotes.author: Mikhail Bakunin

quotes.quote: If idiots could fly, the sky would be like an airport.
quotes.author: Laura Davenport

quotes.quote: You don't want to miss out on something and feel like an idiot.
quotes.author: Kevin Connolly

quotes.quote: I try not to get involved in the business of prediction. It's a quick way to look like an idiot.
quotes.author: Warren Ellis

quotes.quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.quote: You always have to defend the imagination against idiots.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.quote: No man can be a pure specialist without being in the strict sense an idiot.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: There is no mistaking the dismay on the face of a writer who has just heard that his brain child is a deformed idiot.
quotes.author: L. Sprague de Camp

quotes.quote: Every few years I'll party way too much to remind myself what an idiot I am.
quotes.author: Jeff Ament

quotes.quote: Treat everyone the same until you find out they're an idiot.
quotes.author: Lucy Lawless

quotes.quote: It is not necessary for a man to be actively bad in order to make a failure in life; simple inaction will accomplish it. Nature has everywhere written her protest against idleness; everything which ceases to struggle toward an ideal, the constant effort to get higher and further, which develops manhood and character.
quotes.author: James Terry White

quotes.quote: Shun idleness. It is a rust that attaches itself to the most brilliant metals.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Idleness is sweet, and its consequences are cruel.
quotes.author: John Quincy Adams

quotes.quote: There is a perennial nobleness and even sacredness in work. Be he never so benighted and forgetful of his high calling, there is always hope in a man that actually and earnestly works: in Idleness alone is there perpetual Despair.
quotes.author: Albert Pike

quotes.quote: Idleness is the grand Pacific Ocean of life, and in that stagnant abyss the most salutary things produce no good, the most noxious no evil. Vice, indeed, abstractedly considered, may be, and often is engendered in idleness; but the moment it becomes efficiently vice, it must quit its cradle and cease to be idle.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.quote: Idleness is emptiness; the tree in which the sap is stagnant, remains fruitless.
quotes.author: Hosea Ballou

quotes.quote: Avoid idleness, and fill up all the spaces of thy time with severe and useful employment: for lust easily creeps in at those emptinesses where the soul is unemployed and the body is at ease; no easy, healthful, idle person was ever chaste if he could.
quotes.author: Jeremy Taylor

quotes.quote: The soul is made for action, and cannot rest till it be employed. Idleness is its rust. Unless it will up and think and taste and see, all is in vain.
quotes.author: Thomas Traherne

quotes.quote: Love is born of idleness and, once born, by idleness is fostered.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Idleness is not doing nothing. Idleness is being free to do anything.
quotes.author: Floyd Dell

quotes.quote: Idleness is the heaviest of all oppressions.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Idleness is many gathered miseries in one name.
quotes.author: Jean Paul

quotes.quote: Life does not agree with philosophy: There is no happiness that is not idleness, and only what is useless is pleasurable.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.quote: Idleness is an inlet to disorder, and makes way for licentiousness. People who have nothing to do are quickly tired of their own company.
quotes.author: Jeremy Collier

quotes.quote: Far from idleness being the root of all evil, it is rather the only true good.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: Idleness, like kisses, to be sweet must be stolen.
quotes.author: Jerome K. Jerome

quotes.quote: Idleness is the stupidity of the body, and stupidity is the idleness of the mind.
quotes.author: Johann G. Seume

quotes.quote: Gluttony and idleness are two of life's great joys, but they are not honourable.
quotes.author: Julie Burchill

quotes.quote: One of the commonest characteristics of the successful man is his idleness, his immense capacity for wasting time.
quotes.author: Arnold Bennett

quotes.quote: Idleness is only the refuge of weak minds.
quotes.author: Philip Stanhope

quotes.quote: Hunger is not the worst feature of unemployment; idleness is.
quotes.author: William E. Barrett

quotes.quote: A faculty for idleness implies a catholic appetite and a strong sense of personal identity.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: There's never enough time to do all the nothing you want.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.quote: So runs the genealogy of many another sin: idleness is usually the grandfather of the crime, whatever the father might be.
quotes.author: C.H. Spurgeon

quotes.quote: Diligence is the mother of good fortune, and idleness, its opposite, never brought a man to the goal of any of his best wishes.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: It is idleness that is the curse of man - not labour. Idleness eats the heart out of men as of nations, and consumes them as rust does iron.
quotes.author: Samuel Smiles

quotes.quote: Trouble springs from idleness, and grievous toil from needless ease.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: The lot of man is ceaseless labor, Or ceaseless idleness, which is still harder.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot

quotes.quote: Idleness is the beginning of all vice, the crown of all virtues.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.quote: The exquisite art of idleness, one of the most important things that any University can teach.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Nobody can think straight who does not work. Idleness warps the mind.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Idleness is the Dead Sea that swallows all Virtues.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Idleness among children, as among men, is the root of all evil, and leads to no other evil more certain than ill temper.
quotes.author: Hannah More

quotes.quote: Idleness of the mind is much worse than that of the body: wit, without employment, is a disease - the rust of the soul, a plague, a hell itself.
quotes.author: Samuel Smiles

quotes.quote: Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: Remove the temptation of idleness and cupids bow is useless.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Idleness is a constant sin, and labor is a duty. Idleness is the devil's home for temptation and for unprofitable, distracting musings; while labor profit others and ourselves.
quotes.author: Anne Baxter

quotes.quote: Certainly work is not always required of a man. There is such a thing as a sacred idleness, the cultivation of which is now fearfully neglected.
quotes.author: George Mac Donald

quotes.quote: Idleness and timidity often despair without being overcome, and forbear attempts for fear of being defeated; and we may promote the invigoration of faint endeavors, by showing what has already been performed.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: To be idle and to be poor have always been reproaches, and therefore every man endeavors with his utmost care to hide his poverty from others, and his idleness from himself.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Idleness begets ennui, ennui the hypochondriac, and that a diseased body. No laborious person was ever yet hysterical.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Wealth which breeds idleness ... is only a sort of human oyster-bed, where heirs and heiresses are planted, to spend a contemptible life of slothfulness in growing plump and succulent for the grave-worm's banquet.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.quote: Yet it is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.quote: It is idleness that creates impossibilities; and where people don't care to do anything, they shelter themselves under a permission that it cannot be done.
quotes.author: Bishop Robert South

quotes.quote: The idol of today pushes the hero of yesterday out of our recollection; and will, in turn, be supplanted by his successor of tomorrow.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.quote: An idol of the mind is as offensive to God as an idol of the hand.
quotes.author: Aiden Wilson Tozer

quotes.quote: There is no idol more debasing than the worship of money.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.quote: Every idol, if you scratch it, is a mirror. We worship ourselves.
quotes.author: R. C. Sproul

quotes.quote: Idols aren't stone statues. They are thoughts, desires, and longings that we worship in the place of the true God.
quotes.author: Elyse Fitzpatrick

quotes.quote: The man molds the idol and then the idol molds the man.
quotes.author: Adrian Rogers

quotes.quote: You are the equal of the idol who has given you your inspiration.
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac

quotes.quote: Try not to have idols: they are interchangeable and lead to a wantonness that is easily mistaken for love.
quotes.author: Hildegard Knef

quotes.quote: Whatever thing a man gets quickly enraged about is his idol, and whatever thing he makes his idol becomes his religion.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: All the idols made by man, however terrifying they may be, are in point of fact subordinate to him, and that is why he will always have it in his power to destroy them.
quotes.author: Simone De Beauvoir

quotes.quote: We must overturn so many idols, the idol of self first of all, so that we can be humble, and only from our humility can learn to be redeemers, can learn to work together in the way the world really needs.
quotes.author: Oscar Romero

quotes.quote: The idol is the measure of the worshipper.
quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

quotes.quote: When you worship an idol, you're substituting a thing for the ultimate.
quotes.author: Abigail Disney

quotes.quote: Idols are often good things that we have made into ultimate things.
quotes.author: Timothy Keller

quotes.quote: The idol in the temple is not God. But since God resides in every atom, He resides in that idol too.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: An idol is anything put in the place of God as the ultimate reality - the eternal, self-existent, uncaused cause of everything else.
quotes.author: Nancy Pearcey

quotes.quote: Your idol is shattered in the dust to prove that God's dust is greater than your idol.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.quote: An idol is what man makes and then has to carry. God makes a man and then carries him.
quotes.author: Benjamin Whichcote

quotes.quote: We all have idols. Play like anyone you care about but try to be yourself while you're doing so.
quotes.author: B. B. King

quotes.quote: In terms of idols which represented various gods: worshipping an idol or star cluster is no different than worshipping a concept.
quotes.author: Thomas Daniel Nehrer

quotes.quote: Don't idolize anyone if you can. You know, be inspired by people, certainly, but don't idolize people... Because they'll let you down.
quotes.author: Greg Behrendt

quotes.quote: Kids today are looking for idols, but sometimes they look too far ... They don't have to look any farther than their home because those are the people that love you. They are the real heroes.
quotes.author: Bobby Bonilla

quotes.quote: Thus they have an idol that they petition for victory in war; another for success in their labors; and so for everything in which they seek or desire prosperity, they have their idols, which they honor and serve.
quotes.author: Hernando Cortes

quotes.quote: People have an idol they want to be like and try to follow what the idols did. But when you do, you find out you're not very successful and you're not very happy. You try to copy these models, and it doesn't yield successful results.
quotes.author: Clayton Christensen

quotes.quote: The idol is the expression of religion.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.quote: An idol is not necessarily something concrete, like a golden calf. It can also be something abstract, like matter. Is matter part of the created order? Sure it is. So the philosophy of materialism qualifies as an idol in the biblical sense.
quotes.author: Nancy Pearcey

quotes.quote: There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
quotes.author: Charles Darwin

quotes.quote: Ignorance deprives people of freedom because they do not know what alternatives there are. It is impossible to choose to do what one has never heard of.
quotes.author: Ralph B. Perry

quotes.quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Ignorance is always afraid of change.
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.quote: To remove ignorance is an important branch of benevolence.
quotes.author: Ann Plato

quotes.quote: Ignorance, the root and stem of all evil.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: If ignorance is bliss, there should be more happy people.
quotes.author: Victor Cousin

quotes.quote: The only victories which leave no regret are those which are gained over ignorance.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: Better be ignorant of a matter than half know it.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: I am not ashamed to confess I am ignorant of what I do not know.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Where ignorance is our master, there is no possibility of real peace.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: Ignorance breeds monsters to fill up the vacancies of the soul that are unoccupied by the verities of knowledge.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.quote: Ignorance is preferable to error; and he is less remote from the truth who believes nothing, than he who believes what is wrong.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Most ignorance is evincible ignorance. We don't know because we don't want to know.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Ignorance is like a delicate fruit; touch it, and the bloom is gone.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Ignorance is never out of style. It was in fashion yesterday, it is the rage today and it will set the pace tomorrow.
quotes.author: Frank Dane

quotes.quote: Ignorance is not innocence, but sin.
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.quote: Ignorance is the night of the mind, but a night without moon or star.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Ignorance speaks loudly, so as to be heard; but its volume proves reason to doubt every word.
quotes.author: Wes Fessler

quotes.quote: The recipe for perpetual ignorance is: Be satisfied with your opinions and content with your knowledge.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Ignorance is the dominion of absurdity.
quotes.author: James Anthony Froude

quotes.quote: The truest characters of ignorance Are vanity, and pride, and annoyance.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: Ignorance is never better than knowledge.
quotes.author: Enrico Fermi

quotes.quote: Ignorance never settles a question.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: Everybody is ignorant, only on different subjects.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: To be concious that you are ignorant of the facts is a great step toward knowledge.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: I would rather have my ignorance than another man's knowledge, because I have got so much more of it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The little I know, I own to ignorance.
quotes.author: Sacha Guity

quotes.quote: By ignorance the truth is known.
quotes.author: Heinrich Suso

quotes.quote: It may be that the ignorant man, alone, has any chance to mate his life with life.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.quote: I know nothing except the fact of my ignorance.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The most violent element in society is ignorance.
quotes.author: Emma Goldman

quotes.quote: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Ignorance is a virus. Once it starts spreading, it can only be cured by reason. For the sake of humanity, we must be that cure.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.quote: Teach the ignorant as much as you can.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Ignorance is still better than martyrdom.
quotes.author: Ira N. Barin

quotes.quote: Isn't it funny how ignorance is the source of strength of so many?
quotes.author: Lionel Suggs

quotes.quote: Ignorance is an underrated virtue, my lord.
quotes.author: Andrew Levkoff

quotes.quote: Ignorance may be bliss, but only if it outweighs curiosity.
quotes.author: Victoria Schwab

quotes.quote: Read it wisely, Little One, for the power of ignorance is great.
quotes.author: Stephen Fry

quotes.quote: Is it not ignorance that we share? A lie takes two. The truth we find alone.
quotes.author: Anthony Marais

quotes.quote: Ignorance must be prosecuted when arrested. The only way for its arrest is by information and the only way for prosecution is through reading and learning of new things.
quotes.author: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.quote: Even one voice in a wilderness of ignorance is a voice that is heard by someone.
quotes.author: Kristen Ashley

quotes.quote: Thoroughly conscious ignorance is the prelude to every real advance in science.
quotes.author: James Clerk Maxwell

quotes.quote: Ignorance is not a capital crime. It is a correctable condition.
quotes.author: Laura Knight-Jadczyk

quotes.quote: To turn down knowledge is to resign to ignorance.
quotes.author: Kyle Schmalenberg

quotes.quote: To know you are ignorant is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quotes.quote: Ignorance must be a fun place to live; my parents seem to vacation there year-round.
quotes.author: Nenia Campbell

quotes.quote: The ignorance we’re ignorant of is the ignorance most difficult to remedy.
quotes.author: Leah Hager Cohen

quotes.quote: A great deal of intelligence can be invested in ignorance.
quotes.author: Saul Bellow

quotes.quote: The pleasures of ignorance are as great, in their way, as the pleasures of knowledge.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Not ignorance, but ignorance of ignorance, is the death of knowledge.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: To be ignorant of one's ignorance is the malady of ignorance.
quotes.author: A. Bronson Alcott

quotes.quote: It's innocence when it charms us, ignorance when it doesn't.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Ignorance is right!
quotes.author: Christopher Andrea

quotes.quote: You can still be sincere and still be stupid.
quotes.author: Charles F. Kettering

quotes.quote: The mist of ignorance, esteems untrue. Rejecting whatsoever is a wonder.
quotes.author: Ludovico Ariosto

quotes.quote: It is when within the darkness of ignorance when you shout do you shine.
quotes.author: William Andrews

quotes.quote: In guiltless ignorance, in ignorant guilt.
quotes.author: Stephen Crane

quotes.quote: For ignorance, its growth and its protection.
quotes.author: Ezra Pound

quotes.quote: Through ignorance, all troubles did surmount.
quotes.author: Anne Bradstreet

quotes.quote: Pain and ignorance lead to great joy and knowledge because the Supreme Being has created nothing vain under the sun.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: All ignorance toboggans into know and trudges up to ignorance again.
quotes.author: Edward Estlin Cummings

quotes.quote: Ignorance is bliss.
quotes.author: Robert William Service

quotes.quote: Illegal immigration can never be completely stopped, no matter how high the wall or how many patrol agents you have watching it.
quotes.author: Gail Collins

quotes.quote: Illegal immigration is not just a matter of interest in states along our border with Mexico. It is having an effect on local economies, schools, health care delivery, and public safety all across the country.
quotes.author: Roger Wicker

quotes.quote: When you talk about the problem of illegal immigration, people are angry and polarized. When you talk about the answers, the debate gets a little different.
quotes.author: David Brooks

quotes.quote: Illegal immigration is a genuinely national issue, and resolving it requires a national commitment not just on health care but also border control, law enforcement and other resources.
quotes.author: Jon Kyl

quotes.quote: Illegal immigration is crisis for our country. It is an open door for drugs, criminals, and potential terrorists to enter our country. It is straining our economy, adding costs to our judicial, healthcare, and education systems.
quotes.author: Timothy Murphy

quotes.quote: Learning to distinguish the illegal immigrant from the legal immigrant does not solve the problem of illegal immigration.
quotes.author: Jan C. Ting

quotes.quote: If you want to stop illegal immigration, you have to make it so that - so that the people that hire the illegal immigrants will not be in a position to hire them.
quotes.author: Jesse Ventura

quotes.quote: Illegal immigration continues to be a major problem in the United States. We have people waiting to come here legally. And we should not be rewarding people who have come here illegally.
quotes.author: John Barrasso

quotes.quote: Enforcement alone does not work. Unless we address the gap between our immigration laws and reality, illegal immigration will not stop and the situation on the border will continue to be chaotic.
quotes.author: Harry Reid

quotes.quote: The key that opens that door is proving to the American public that illegal immigration is under control. And at this point, that argument cannot be made because it is not true, it is not under control.
quotes.author: Marco Rubio

quotes.quote: You reduce illegal immigration by making it harder to get jobs here, or easier to get jobs south of the border. This idea that we can't pass an immigration law until we hit some imaginary security target is just a way to derail reform.
quotes.author: Gail Collins

quotes.quote: There is no quick fix for illegal immigration. But only when we achieve better control of our borders and better respect for our immigration laws can we give meaning to the discussion we need to have over reforming the numbers, categories, and procedures for legal immigration into the United States.
quotes.author: Jan C. Ting

quotes.quote: One of the defining characteristics or difference between today's illegal immigration and the immigration of old is the immigrants of the late 1800s through the early 1920s came here desiring to become Americans. They wanted to become part of what was a unique and distinct American culture. They were all coming from tyranny of one kind or another.
quotes.author: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.quote: Illegal immigration is praised only by those who benefit directly from it, whether in the familial sense of inexpensive nannies, cooks, or gardeners; or in the corporate interest of cheap labor in the hospitality industries, agriculture, and construction; or in the political sense of new liberal constituents; or in the tribal sense of expanding the so-called La Raza base. But the vast majority of Americans accept that when federal law is ignored, chaos ensues.
quotes.author: Victor Davis Hanson

quotes.quote: Ending illegal immigration only strengthens legal immigration.
quotes.author: Mitt Romney

quotes.quote: The economic impact of illegal immigration on taxpayers is catastrophic.
quotes.author: Ric Keller

quotes.quote: We must say no to illegal immigration so we can continue to say yes to legal immigration.
quotes.author: William J. Clinton

quotes.quote: We have no borders. Our vets are being treated horribly. Illegal immigration is beyond belief.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.quote: Hospitals are closing across the country due to the burden of illegal immigration, college students find that summer jobs have dried up due to illegal immigration, and wages across the board are depressed by the overwhelming influx of cheap and illegal labor.
quotes.author: Elton Gallegly

quotes.quote: My mother said I must always be intolerant of ignorance but understanding of illiteracy. That some people, unable to go to school, were more educated and more intelligent than college professors.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Better to lose a book to a child, than to lose a child to illiteracy.
quotes.author: Richard Allington

quotes.quote: Elimination of illiteracy is as serious an issue to our history as the abolition of slavery.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: As a child I experienced firsthand the severe effects of poverty and illiteracy, especially upon women and children. My parents taught me the importance of education and that it was a key to improving an individual's life.
quotes.author: Naveen Jain

quotes.quote: As centuries of dictators have known, an illiterate crowd is the easiest to rule; since the craft of reading cannot be untaught once it has been acquired, the second-best recourse is to limit its scope.
quotes.author: Alberto Manguel

quotes.quote: The greatest illiterate is the inability to learn the great things of life from small things around.
quotes.author: Matthew Ashimolowo

quotes.quote: When an illiterate gets angry, you'll get to understand that calmness is probably a sign of education.
quotes.author: Michael Bassey

quotes.quote: It's a great lesson in modesty that you realize you're illiterate in a field that you think you're an expert in.
quotes.author: Wim Wenders

quotes.quote: The illiterate of the future will not be the man who cannot read the alphabet, but the one who cannot take a photograph.
quotes.author: Walter Benjamin

quotes.quote: Educational legislation nowadays is largely in the hands of illiterate people, and the illiterate will take good care that their illiteracy is not made a reproach on them.
quotes.author: Katharine Elizabeth Fullerton Gerould

quotes.quote: The problem is not scientifically illiterate kids; it is scientifically illiterate adults. Kids are born curious about the natural world. They are always turning over rocks, jumping with two feet into mud puddles and playing with the tablecloth and fine china.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.quote: There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.
quotes.author: Joseph Brodsky

quotes.quote: The person who deserves most pity is a lonesome one on a rainy day who doesn't know how to read.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: The illiterate of the 21st century will not be those who cannot read and write, but those who cannot learn, unlearn, and relearn.
quotes.author: Alvin Toffler

quotes.quote: 70 out of 100 people in the world cannot read... if you can read then you are the luckiest out of 2 million people in the world that cannot.
quotes.author: Call Bain

quotes.quote: Illness is regarded as a crime, and crime is regarded as illness.
quotes.author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

quotes.quote: Sickness comes on horseback but departs on foot.
quotes.author: Proverb

quotes.quote: Illness cannot exist in a body that has harmonious thoughts.
quotes.author: Rhonda Byrne

quotes.quote: You can trace every sickness, every disease and every ailment to a mineral deficiency
quotes.author: Linus Pauling

quotes.quote: Illness is the result of improper removal of toxins from the body. Oxygen is the vital factor which assists the body in removing toxins.
quotes.author: Ed McCabe

quotes.quote: All illness no matter whether you stubbed your toe, battle cancer or are blowing your nose constantly with a common cold is simply slowed down vibration.
quotes.author: Catherine Carrigan

quotes.quote: Illness or pain is just an extension of negative emotion. When you are no longer feeling any resistance to it, it's a non-issue.
quotes.author: Esther Hicks

quotes.quote: Because there is no glory in illness. There is no meaning to it. There is no honor in dying of.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: Illness is the most heeded of doctors: to goodness and wisdom we only make promises; pain we obey.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: Illness is the opposite of freedom. It makes everything impossible.
quotes.author: Francoise Sagan

quotes.quote: It is in moments of illness that we are compelled to recognize that we live not alone but chained to a creature of a different kingdom, whole worlds apart, who has no knowledge of us and by whom it is impossible to make ourselves understood: our body.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: The more serious the illness, the more important it is for you to fight back, mobilizing all your resources-spiritual, emotional, intellectual, physical.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: Sickness is an illusion, to be annihilated by Science.
quotes.author: Mary Baker Eddy

quotes.quote: Illness is the great equalizer. It doesn't matter who you are, rich or poor, young or old, fat or thin, sick is sick.
quotes.author: Fran Drescher

quotes.quote: Sickness sometimes is a great blessing. People become angels through sickness.
quotes.author: Spencer W Kimball

quotes.quote: For every human illness, somewhere in the world there exists a plant which is the cure.
quotes.author: Rudolf Steiner

quotes.quote: Chronic disease is a foodborne illness. We ate our way into this mess, and we must eat our way out.
quotes.author: Mark Hyman

quotes.quote: The easiest time to cure an illness is before it is accepted as a part of the self-image.
quotes.author: Jane Roberts

quotes.quote: Sickness is the first warning that we have made a wrong judgement. A healthy person is never unhappy.
quotes.author: George Ohsawa

quotes.quote: The secret of learning to be sick is this: Illness doesn't make you less of what you were. You are still you.
quotes.author: Tony Snow

quotes.quote: To heal illness, begin by restoring balance.
quotes.author: Caroline Myss

quotes.quote: Illness is the night side of life, a more onerous citizenship. Everyone who is born holds dual citizenship, in the kingdom of the well and in the kingdom of the sick. Although we all prefer to use the good passport, sooner or later each of us is obliged, at least for a spell, to identify ourselves as citizens of that other place.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.quote: Mental illness can happen to anybody. You can be a dustman, a politician, a Tesco worker... anyone. It could be your dad, your brother or your aunt.
quotes.author: Frank Bruno

quotes.quote: Illness sets the mind free sometimes to roam and surmise.
quotes.author: Alice B. Toklas

quotes.quote: Every sickness has an alien quality, a feeling of invasion and loss of control that is evident in the language we use about it.
quotes.author: Siri Hustvedt

quotes.quote: Illness can make us behave in the most surprising ways.
quotes.author: Susan Minot

quotes.quote: The essence of illness is the freezing of behavior into unalterable and insatiable patterns.
quotes.author: Lawrence S. Kubie

quotes.quote: Recovery from illness often seems like beginning life all over again.
quotes.author: Cornelia Meigs

quotes.quote: Think about it: Heart disease and diabetes, which account for more deaths in the U.S. and worldwide than everything else combined, are completely preventable by making comprehensive lifestyle changes. Without drugs or surgery.
quotes.author: Dean Ornish

quotes.quote: What worse illness can there be than acute conventionality. You should pray every night that you don't wake up with it.
quotes.author: George Weinberg

quotes.quote: Most illness is just stress from not living in harmony.
quotes.author: Bruce H. Lipton

quotes.quote: Illness is a clumsy attempt to arrive at health: we must come to nature's aid with intellect.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Your illness is not your identity. Your chemistry is not your character.
quotes.author: Rick Warren

quotes.quote: Mental illness leaves a huge legacy, not just for the person suffering it but for those around them.
quotes.author: Lysette Anthony

quotes.quote: Whether an illness affects your heart, your leg or your brain, it's still an illness, and there should be no distinction.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.quote: Even if you have a terminal disease, you don't have to sit down and mope. Enjoy life and challenge the illness that you have.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: Any other illness, any other disease that we're faced with, there's sympathy and understanding. We get help for those. With mental illness, our go-to is to categorize them as, 'Oh, they're crazy,' to belittle the problem.
quotes.author: Chris Wood

quotes.quote: Sickness is felt, but health not at all.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: Every illness is an opportunity for compassionate revelations.
quotes.author: Judith Orloff

quotes.quote: Sickness is the vengeance of nature for the violation of her laws.
quotes.author: Charles Simmons

quotes.quote: Sickness is a sort of early old age; it teaches us a diffidence in our earthly state.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.quote: Even sickness becomes an experience that we pass through in happiness because our happiness is not dependent upon how our body feels, but how our spirit feels.
quotes.author: Frederick Lenz

quotes.quote: Illness is the doctor to whom we pay most heed; to kindness, to knowledge, we make promise only; pain we obey.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.quote: Illness is merely the bitter, which a wise Providence mingles in the cup of life.
quotes.author: James Holman

quotes.quote: Illness is often a sign that you need to make an adjustment in your life path.
quotes.author: Christiane Northrup

quotes.quote: All illnesses have some heredity contribution. It's been said that genetics loads the gun and environment pulls the trigger.
quotes.author: Francis Collins

quotes.quote: An illness is like a journey into a far country; it sifts all one's experience and removes it to a point so remote that it appears like a vision.
quotes.author: Sholem Asch

quotes.quote: The number one root of all illness, as we know, is stress.
quotes.author: Marianne Williamson

quotes.quote: It is in sickness that we most feel the need of that sympathy which shows how much we are dependent upon one another for our comfort, and even necessities. Thus disease, opening our eyes to the realities of life, is an indirect blessing.
quotes.author: Hosea Ballou

quotes.quote: Illness isn't the only thing that spoils the appetite.
quotes.author: Ivan Turgenev

quotes.quote: Love is the kind of illness that does not spare the intelligent or the dull.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: There is no illness that is not exacerbated by stress.
quotes.author: Allan Lokos

quotes.quote: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: If you be sick, your own thoughts make you sick
quotes.author: Ben Jonson

quotes.quote: If a person can turn from predicting illness to anticipating recovery, the foundation for cure is laid.
quotes.author: Bernie Siegel

quotes.quote: You matter because you are you, and you matter to the end of your life. We will do all we can not only to help you die peacefully, but also to live until you die.
quotes.author: Cicely Saunders

quotes.quote: I didn't want to do a zoo show. I didn't want to do a study of someone with mental illness. I just wanted to show someone who was trying to live their life.
quotes.author: Daniel Craig

quotes.quote: Romantic love is mental illness. But it's a pleasurable one. It's a drug. It distorts reality, and that's the point of it. It would be impossible to fall in love with someone that you really saw.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: I assume that to prevent illness in later life, you should never have been born at all.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: The wise man should consider that health is the greatest of human blessings. Let food be your medicine.
quotes.author: Hippocrates

quotes.quote: Life is a series of baby steps along the way and if you add up these tiny little steps you take toward your goal, whatever it is, whether it's giving up something, a terrible addiction or trying to work your way through an illness. When you total up those baby steps you'd be amazed over the course of 10 years, the strides you've taken.
quotes.author: Hoda Kotb

quotes.quote: People are always selling the idea that people with mental illness are suffering. I think madness can be an escape. If things are not so good, you maybe want to imagine something better.
quotes.author: John Forbes Nash

quotes.quote: People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
quotes.author: John Wanamaker

quotes.quote: Life always gives us exactly the teacher we need at every moment. This includes every mosquito, every misfortune, every red light, every traffic jam, every obnoxious supervisor (or employee), every illness, every loss, every moment of joy or depression, every addiction, every piece of garbage, every breath. Every moment is the guru.
quotes.author: Joko Beck

quotes.quote: A lot of people don't realize that depression is an illness. I don't wish it on anyone, but if they would know how it feels, I swear they would think twice before they just shrug it.
quotes.author: Jonathan Davis

quotes.quote: Psychoanalysis is that mental illness for which it regards itself as therapy.
quotes.author: Karl Kraus

quotes.quote: Through my illness I learned rejection. I was written off. That was the moment I thought, Okay, game on. No prisoners. Everybody's going down.
quotes.author: Lance Armstrong.

quotes.quote: A man's illness is his private territory and, no matter how much he loves you and how close you are, you stay an outsider. You are healthy.
quotes.author: Lauren Bacall

quotes.quote: We have much to be judged on when he comes, slums and battlefields and insane asylums, but these are the symptoms of our illness and the result of our failures in love.
quotes.author: Madeleine L'Engle

quotes.quote: People get really irritated by mental illness.
quotes.author: Maria Bamford

quotes.quote: Each patient carries his own doctor inside him.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: We learn as much from sorrow as from joy, as much from illness as from health, from handicap as from advantage and indeed perhaps more.
quotes.author: Pearl S. Buck

quotes.quote: Just like those who are incurably ill, the aged know everything about their dying except exactly when.
quotes.author: Philip Roth

quotes.quote: Stress is nothing more than a socially acceptable form of mental illness.
quotes.author: Richard Carlson

quotes.quote: The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four Americans is suffering from some form of mental illness. Think of your three best friends. If they're okay, then it's you.
quotes.author: Rita Mae Brown

quotes.quote: If we are suffering illness, poverty, or misfortune, we think we shall be satisfied on the day it ceases. But there too, we know it is false; so soon as one has got used to not suffering one wants something else.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.quote: When you die, it does not mean that you lose to cancer, you beat cancer by how you live, why you live and in the manner in which you live.
quotes.author: Stuart Scott

quotes.quote: Money is a result, wealth is a result, health is a result, illness is a result, your weight is a result. We live in a world of cause and effect.
quotes.author: T. Harv Eker

quotes.quote: Mental illness, of course, is not literally a "thing" - or physical object - and hence it can "exist" only in the same sort of way in which other theoretical concepts exist.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz

quotes.quote: The most important thing when ill is to never lose heart.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
quotes.author: Arthur Koestler

quotes.quote: Illusion is the first of all pleasures.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Illusion is needed to disguise the emptiness within.
quotes.author: Arthur Erickson

quotes.quote: Illusion is an anodyne, bred by the gap between wish and reality.
quotes.author: Herman Wouk

quotes.quote: With true beauty, there is no illusion.
quotes.author: James Philip Head

quotes.quote: The illusion that times that were are better than those that are, has probably pervaded all ages.
quotes.author: Horace Greeley

quotes.quote: The one person who has more illusions than the dreamer is the man of action.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: All illusion comes and goes, but the soul remains unchanged.
quotes.author: Meher Baba

quotes.quote: Animation is about creating the illusion of life. And you can't create it if you don't have one.
quotes.author: Brad Bird

quotes.quote: Illusion begets and sustains the world; we do not destroy one without destroying the other.
quotes.author: Emil Cioran

quotes.quote: There's no point in clinging to illusions.
quotes.author: Eva Heller

quotes.quote: Illusions commend themselves to us because they save us pain and allow us to enjoy pleasure instead. We must therefore accept it without complaint when they sometimes collide with a bit of reality against which they are dashed to pieces.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: We must select the illusion which appeals to our temperament and embrace it with passion, if we want to be happy.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: A pleasant illusion is better than a harsh reality.
quotes.author: Christian Nevell Bovee

quotes.quote: Illusion is no longer possible, because the real is no longer possible.
quotes.author: Jean Baudrillard

quotes.quote: Limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.quote: One day everything will be well, that is our hope. Everything's fine today, that is our illusion.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Nothing except a positive illusion can possibly have a future,
quotes.author: Northrop Frye

quotes.quote: There are two kinds of illusion, the negative illusion which merely fails to be a reality, and the illusion which exists as a potentiality or model in the mind, as a fiction which does not yet exist but may be brought into existence or realized by a creative mind.
quotes.author: Northrop Frye

quotes.quote: If the human race were to destroy both itself and the planet it lives on, that would be the final triumph of illusion.
quotes.author: Northrop Frye

quotes.quote: Surely, living in an illusion is the greatest of torments, and becoming disillusioned ought to feel like being let out of jail.
quotes.author: Northrop Frye

quotes.quote: The mystic finds, at the heart of the illusion of space, a real presence.
quotes.author: Northrop Frye

quotes.quote: You too must not count overmuch on your reality as you feel it today, since, like that of yesterday, it may prove an illusion for you tomorrow.
quotes.author: Luigi Pirandello

quotes.quote: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: Every age is fed on illusions, lest men should renounce life early and the human race comes to an end.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: Illusion is always based on reality, for its strength depends upon its fit with the desires, fears and experiences of countless humans.
quotes.author: John P. Grier

quotes.quote: Rob the average man of his illusion and you rob him of his happiness at one stroke.
quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

quotes.quote: A man loses his illusions first, his teeth second, and his follies last.
quotes.author: Helen Rowland

quotes.quote: The notion that as a man grows older, his illusions leave him is not quite true. What is true is that his early illusions are supplanted by new, and to him, equally convincing illusions.
quotes.author: George Jean Nathan

quotes.quote: The eyes are not responsible when the mind does the seeing.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: It isn't safe to sit in judgment upon another person's illusion when you are not on the inside. While you are thinking it is a dream, he maybe knowing it is a planet.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: No man will be found in whose mind airy notions do not sometimes tyrannize, and force him to hope or fear beyond the limits of sober probability.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: It appears to me that almost every man may, like the spider, spin from his own inwards his own airy citadel.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.quote: For what we call illusions are often, in truth, a wider vision of past and present realities—a willing movement of a man's soul with the larger sweep of the world's forces—a movement towards a more assured end than the chances of a single life.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: The key, during both life and death, is to recognize illusions as illusions, projections as projections, and fantasies as fantasies. In this way we become free.
quotes.author: Lama Thubten Yeshe

quotes.quote: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.quote: More than any other American sport, baseball creates the magnetic, addictive illusion that it can almost be understood.
quotes.author: Thomas Boswell

quotes.quote: The American Dream became America's god; wealth and abundance have become the measure of America's success. But—as recent events have shown— we have been living an illusion.
quotes.author: Billy Graham

quotes.quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Certainly generally is illusion, and repose is not the destiny of man.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: We live in the illusion that we are all separate 'I ams.' When the fog finally clears, we shall know there is only One.
quotes.author: Barbara Brown Taylor

quotes.quote: Some seem as alive, / But seem as died, / Some seem as died, / But seem have lives, / It can not realize, / By an ordinary eye.
quotes.author: Mazloom Gill

quotes.quote: Now freedom in the world / Just as like as illusion / Modern slavery called freedom / No one can claim it / No one can have it.
quotes.author: Mazloom Gill

quotes.quote: Only the Knower knows / That music cannot be written / How can then be the notes / Says Kabir, awareness alone will overcome illusion.
quotes.author: Kabir

quotes.quote: Since I am a poet / I express it in exact words, / Which illustrate a truth / And reality / However, it can be an illusion, / Far from the facts / But the direct narration / With a direct figure / It verifies the truth and reality.
quotes.author: Ehsan Sehgal

quotes.quote: It wasn't love, it wasn't love / It was a perfect illusion (perfect illusion) / Mistaken for love, it wasn't love / It was a perfect illusion (perfect illusion) / You were a perfect illusion.
quotes.author: Stefani J. Germanotta

quotes.quote: No baby this is not an illusion / I've really got my heart out on my sleeve / Oh baby this is not an illusion / There's magic between you and me / No baby this is not an illusion / You really got me lifted off 'my feet / So tell me you believe in love / 'Cause it's not an illusion to me.
quotes.author: Liam Payne

quotes.quote: A wisely chosen illustration is almost essential to fasten the truth upon the ordinary mind, and no teacher can afford to neglect this part of his preparation.
quotes.author: Howard Crosby

quotes.quote: Illustrations can be a big window: a looking glass into the author's imagination.
quotes.author: Tony DiTerlizzi

quotes.quote: No man with a conscience can just bat out illustrations. He's got to put all his talent and feeling into them!
quotes.author: Norman Rockwell

quotes.quote: A witty illustration or an apt story will accomplish more than columns of argument.
quotes.author: Chauncey Depew

quotes.quote: An illustration is a visual editorial - its just as nuanced. Everything that goes into it is a call you make: every color, every line weight, every angle.
quotes.author: Charles M. Blow

quotes.quote: I was tired of illustration. You'd work so hard on a commission and it would go in to a magazine, and you'd turn the page and it was gone.
quotes.author: Richard MacDonald

quotes.quote: You have to make thousands and thousands of drawings before an illustration is perfected.
quotes.author: Richard MacDonald

quotes.quote: Illustration is commercial. It's work that we produce, and I think what you can do is you can draw from the pool of art, but most of it comes from a pool of knowledge.
quotes.author: Brian Stelfreeze

quotes.quote: Illustrations have as much to say as the text. The trick is to say the same thing, but in a different way. It's no good being an illustrator who is saying a lot that is on his or her mind, if it has nothing to do with the text. . . the artist must override the story, but he must also override his own ego for the sake of the story.
quotes.author: Maurice Sendak

quotes.quote: The illustration which solves one difficulty by raising another, settles nothing.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: My life is an open book. With illustrations.
quotes.author: Hugh Hefner

quotes.quote: There is no line between fine art and illustration; there is no high or low art; there is only art, and it comes in many forms.
quotes.author: James Gurney

quotes.quote: We may smile at these matters, but they are melancholy illustrations.
quotes.author: Joseph Howe

quotes.quote: Dreams are illustrations from the book your soul is writing about you.
quotes.author: Marsha Norman

quotes.quote: A picture should be a re-creation of an event rather than an illustration of an object; but there is no tension in the picture unless there is a struggle with the object.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: It is through imagination that we transcend understanding and travel into the world of possibilities.
quotes.author: Danielle Pierre

quotes.quote: The imagination is the golden pathway to everywhere.
quotes.author: Terence McKenna

quotes.quote: Change your mental imagery, and the feelings will take care of themselves.
quotes.author: Maxwell Maltz

quotes.quote: The awareness of imagery is part of living a life which derives its power from within itself will focus on the perception of images.
quotes.author: Oskar Kokoschka

quotes.quote: When an idea is important to a person or culture it will find its way into imagery.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: The graceful wings of a dove lead to the endless imagination in a dream wings of pain.
quotes.author: Auliq Ice

quotes.quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Use your imagination to create your beautiful life.
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: Visual journaling allows us to access our inner language of imagery and express it both verbally and visually, while exploring the connection between image and word.
quotes.author: Michael Bell

quotes.quote: The mental imagery involved with pianistic tactilia is not related to the striking of individual keys but rather to the rites of passage between notes.
quotes.author: Glenn Gould

quotes.quote:
The brain had its own food on which it battened, and the imagination,
made grotesque by terror, twisted and distorted as a living thing by pain, danced like some foul puppet on a stand and grinned through moving masks.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Creating visual imagery is a state of mind. It involves the reproduction of what we see. But much more than that, it becomes an outlet to express feelings about what we experience.
quotes.author: Tracy Sabin

quotes.quote: The imagery is very much released from reality. It's not nailed down to specifics of the words. They're painting a picture, not telling linear stories.
quotes.author: Daniel B. Shapiro

quotes.quote: Imagination is the bridge between what is and what could be it is everything.
quotes.author: Dalton Frey

quotes.quote: The visionary starts with a clean sheet of paper, and re-imagines the world.
quotes.author: Malcolm Gladwell

quotes.quote: Poetry carries the imagery which is large enough for the kind of life we want for ourselves.
quotes.author: David Whyte

quotes.quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Imagination is not only the uniquely human capacity to envision that which is not, and therefore the fount of all invention and innovation. In its arguably most transformative and revelatory capacity, it is the power to that enables us to empathize with humans whose experiences we have never shared.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.quote: To know how scientists engage in visual imagery is to understand how they think creatively.
quotes.author: E. O. Wilson

quotes.quote: The photographic image is a message without a code.
quotes.author: Roland Barthes

quotes.quote: Imagery is powerful. Imagery is provocative satellite imagery much more so because it is from space, and it allows us to get this perspective that we don't have to have otherwise.
quotes.author: Sarah Parcak

quotes.quote: The use of mental imagery is one of the strongest and most effective strategies for making something happen for you.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: Imagery is not past but present. It rests with what we call our mental processes to place these images in a temporal order.
quotes.author: George Herbert Mead

quotes.quote: Imagination is a gift given to us from God and each one of us use it differently.
quotes.author: Brian Jacques

quotes.quote: The practice of imagination, on an everyday basis, involves clearing unhelpful images that block or misdirect our energies, and choosing to focus on positive, mobilizing imagery that gives us courage and confidence.
quotes.author: Robert Moss

quotes.quote: The original quality in any man of imagination is imagery.
quotes.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: A strong visual imagination acts as a magnet to draw the visualised into reality.
quotes.author: Anupama Garg

quotes.quote: Dreaming means â€˜rehearsing' what you see, playing it over and over in your mind until it becomes as real to you as your life right now.
quotes.author: Emmitt Smith

quotes.quote: Imagination paints a charming view of the future, conveniently adapted to the demands of our current emotion.
quotes.author: John Armstrong

quotes.quote: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: I imagine that yes is the only living thing.
quotes.author: E. E. Cummings

quotes.quote: To treat your facts with imagination is one thing, to imagine your facts is another.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.quote: Imagination grows by exercise, and contrary to common belief, is more powerful in the mature than in the young.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: I imagine, therefore I belong and am free.
quotes.author: Lawrence Durrell

quotes.quote: Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create.
quotes.author: Maria Montessori

quotes.quote: Imagination is the golden-eyed monster that never sleeps. It must be fed; it cannot be ignored.
quotes.author: Patricia A. Mckillip

quotes.quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Reason is intelligence taking exercise. Imagination is intelligence with an erection.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Because when you are imagining, you might as well imagine something worth while.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery

quotes.quote: Imagination means nothing without doing.
quotes.author: Charles Chaplin

quotes.quote: The imagination is a palette of bright colors. You can use it to touch up memories ? or you can use it to paint dreams.
quotes.author: Robert Brault

quotes.quote: Nothing encourages creativity like the chance to fall flat on one's face.
quotes.author: James D. Finley

quotes.quote: The creative person is both more primitive and more cultivated, more destructive, a lot madder and a lot saner, than the average person.
quotes.author: Frank Barron

quotes.quote: Sometimes imagination pounces; mostly it sleeps soundly in the corner, purring.
quotes.author: Terri Guillemets

quotes.quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.quote: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
quotes.author: Lauren Bacall

quotes.quote: Perhaps imagination is only intelligence having fun.
quotes.author: George Scialabba

quotes.quote: I believe in the imagination. What I cannot see is infinitely more important than what I can see.
quotes.author: Duane Michals

quotes.quote: Those who do not think outside the box are easily contained.
quotes.author: Nicolas Manetta

quotes.quote: Creative minds have always been known to survive any kind of bad training.
quotes.author: Anna Freud

quotes.quote: To think creatively, we must be able to look afresh at what we normally take for granted.
quotes.author: George Kneller

quotes.quote: Imagination governs the world.
quotes.author: Napolon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not; a sense of humor to console him for what he is.
quotes.author: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: The imagination is man's power over nature.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.quote: My imagination makes me human and makes me a fool; it gives me all the world and exiles me from it.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.quote: The imagination, give it the least license, dives deeper and soars higher than Nature goes.
quotes.author: Henery David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Imagination is an inner resource. That's why it takes stopping, slowing, silencing, reassuring, embracing to allow it to speak.
quotes.author: Suzanne Beth Stinnett

quotes.quote: Imagination is actually a form of computation. Imagination gives calculated and instinctive solutions for the future.
quotes.author: L. Ron Hubbard

quotes.quote: It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong, than to be always right by having no ideas at all.
quotes.author: Edward de Bono

quotes.quote: Imagination is the voice of daring. If there is anything godlike about God, it is that. He dared to imagine everything
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.quote: Fantasy was always only a reality waiting to be switched on.
quotes.author: Joe Hill

quotes.quote: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.quote: All the works of man have their origin in creative fantasy. What right have we then to depreciate imagination.
quotes.author: Carl Gustav Jung

quotes.quote: Imagination disposes of everything; it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which is everything in this world.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: The quality of the imagination is to flow and not to freeze.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Imagination is not a talent of some people but is the health of everyone.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Imagination is a poor matter when it has to part company with understanding.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: Only in men's imagination does every truth find an effective and undeniable existence. Imagination, not invention, is the supreme master of art as of life.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: Imagination is always the fabric of social life and the dynamic of history. The influence of real needs and compulsions, of real interests and materials, is indirect because the crowd is never conscious of it.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.quote: The imagination is never governed, it is always the ruling and divine power.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: A strong imagination begetteth opportunity.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: The imagination is the secret and marrow of civilization.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: Imagination allows you to see things in a non-traditional, non-restrictive manner. Your imagination is your picture of what tomorrow may bring.
quotes.author: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.quote: Imagination is the only key to the future. Without it none exists - with it all things are possible.
quotes.author: Ida Tarbell

quotes.quote: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.
quotes.author: Jean Jacques Rousseau
